00033 # Description: To verify that the device correctly sends reset segments 
00034 #              while in a sync state

00038 import unittest 
00039 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00040 from pcs.packets import tcp
00041 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00042 import tcptest
00043 import pcs
00044 import pdb, time, random
00045 
00046 class TestResetFromNonSyncState(unittest.TestCase):
00047     """
00048        RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00049        Page 37 - Reset Generation  
00050 
00051        3.  If the connection is in a synchronized state (ESTABLISHED,
00052         FIN-WAIT-1, FIN-WAIT-2, CLOSE-WAIT, CLOSING, LAST-ACK, TIME-WAIT),
00053         any unacceptable segment (out of window sequence number or
00054         unacceptible acknowledgment number) must elicit only an empty
00055         acknowledgment segment containing the current send-sequence number
00056         and an acknowledgment indicating the next sequence number expected
00057         to be received, and the connection remains in the same state.
00058     
00059         If an incoming segment has a security level, or compartment, or
00060         precedence which does not exactly match the level, and compartment,
00061         and precedence requested for the connection,a reset is sent and
00062         connection goes to the CLOSED state.  The reset takes its sequence
00063         number from the ACK field of the incoming segment.
00064     
00065        [PREPARATION]
00066        ==at DEVICE UNDER TEST(DUT)
00067          inetd with descard server running (port 9)
00068     """
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072     def resetTcb(self, tcb):
00073 
00074         tcb.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00075                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")}
00076 
00077 
00078         tcb.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1, (1<<16)-1) , \
00079                       self.thatside : 0}
00080 
00081  
00082         tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00083                          self.thatside : 9}
00084 
00085         tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00086                              self.thatside : 0}
00087 
00088 
00089         tcb.ether = \
00090                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00091                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00092 
00093 
00094         tcb.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") , \
00095                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") }
00096 
00097 
00098     def setUp(self):
00099         """
00100         """
00101         import random
00102         
00103         #constants
00104         self.thisside = 0
00105         self.thatside = 1
00106 
00107         self.tcb = tcptest.tcb()
00108         self.resetTcb( self.tcb )
00109         
00110     def testResetFromSyncStateEstablished(self):
00111         
00112         """
00113            RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00114            Page 37 - Reset Generation  
00115     
00116            3.  If the connection is in a synchronized state (ESTABLISHED,
00117             FIN-WAIT-1, FIN-WAIT-2, CLOSE-WAIT, CLOSING, LAST-ACK, TIME-WAIT),
00118             any unacceptable segment (out of window sequence number or
00119             unacceptible acknowledgment number) must elicit only an empty
00120             acknowledgment segment containing the current send-sequence number
00121             and an acknowledgment indicating the next sequence number expected
00122             to be received, and the connection remains in the same state.
00123         
00124             If an incoming segment has a security level, or compartment, or
00125             precedence which does not exactly match the level, and compartment,
00126             and precedence requested for the connection,a reset is sent and
00127             connection goes to the CLOSED state.  The reset takes its sequence
00128             number from the ACK field of the incoming segment.
00129 
00130            Sent an unacceptable ACK to an established connection.
00131         """
00132 
00133         #(1)establish a connection
00134         tcptest.threewayhandshakenoopt(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00135         
00136         (ip, tcp) = tcptest.createoutofwindowack(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00137         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ip, tcp, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00138         
00139         (iprst, tcprst) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00140         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcprst, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcp)
00141 
00142 
00143     def testResetFromSyncStateCloseWait(self):
00144         
00145         """
00146            RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00147            Page 37 - Reset Generation  
00148     
00149            3.  If the connection is in a synchronized state (ESTABLISHED,
00150             FIN-WAIT-1, FIN-WAIT-2, CLOSE-WAIT, CLOSING, LAST-ACK, TIME-WAIT),
00151             any unacceptable segment (out of window sequence number or
00152             unacceptible acknowledgment number) must elicit only an empty
00153             acknowledgment segment containing the current send-sequence number
00154             and an acknowledgment indicating the next sequence number expected
00155             to be received, and the connection remains in the same state.
00156         
00157             If an incoming segment has a security level, or compartment, or
00158             precedence which does not exactly match the level, and compartment,
00159             and precedence requested for the connection,a reset is sent and
00160             connection goes to the CLOSED state.  The reset takes its sequence
00161             number from the ACK field of the incoming segment.
00162 
00163            Sent an unacceptable ACK to an established connection.
00164         """
00165 
00166         #(1)establish a connection
00167         tcptest.threewayhandshakenoopt(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00168         
00169         #send FIN
00170         (ipfin, tcpfin) = tcptest.createfin(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00171         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00172 
00173         #receive and check ACK or ACK + FIN
00174         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00175         tcptest.assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00176 
00177         #setting an out of window acknowledgment
00178         (ip, tcp) = tcptest.createoutofwindowack(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00179         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ip, tcp, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00180         
00181         #waiting for a RST
00182         (iprst, tcprst) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00183         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcprst, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcp)
00184 
00185 
00186 if __name__ == '__main__':
00187     unittest.main()
